title: "The Is What You Get B*TCH ... "
body_text:
"... Take my ten event back!"
, Letsche loudly and proudly proclaimed just seconds before the 2007
ROOKIE of the Year
was met with a pan-full of whipped-cream.
.......
The obsession with redemption was ever-so evident for the innovative catching machine
Ryan Letsche
and partner-in-crime
Lauren Stopa
, combining their unlimited resources just for an ounce, or a taste if you will, of vindication.
But the athletically-blessed
Grant Cornero
and
EastCoastDodgeball
framer
Lauren Winston
were the paper favorites heading into what many considered to be the most eagerly-anticipated mid-season showdown of them all.
Flash Results by Game
Letsche/Stopa: 2, 4, 5, 6
Cornero/Winston: 1, 3
The "Wild Wild West", otherwise known as the luckiest place in eastern Jersey, was hallowed ground on this wet and windy February '08 evening. Both pairs of resilient co-captains fought tooth and nail throughout, especially in the opening onslaughts.
The first four confrontations were equally divided amongst the leading generals. Game 5 however broke the curse of the "east" with the deadly Letsche-Stopa combo gaining the multiple point edge.
In the nail-biting finale, Cornero-Winston's match-tying efforts were remorselessly shot down and by the end of the barbaric six, the advantage leaned solely in favor of "The UnSTOPAble One" and her never-say-die commanding ally.
It's probably a safe bet to assume this was indeed one "sweet" victory for the Letsche-Stopa duo. Their 4 to 2 triumph allowed for these now timeless videos ...
CREAMation 5
RECORDS
> Attendance: 16
> New Players: 0
- Aside from the
CREAMation 5
, DODGEBALL 125 will also be remembered as
Wet War XXV
. What's odd is that only one
CREAMation
(
C. Adams vs. Fitzpatrick
) was not a
Wet War
- ain't that something!
- In the gigantic team brawl, Lauren Stopa and Ryan Letsche avenged their losses from times' past, defeating Lauren Winston and Grant Cornero, 4  to 2.
..
Lauren Stopa
may have benefited the most: first woman to headline a mid-season main event (along with L. Winston); first team war; first win of her career (1-3-0)!
..
Ryan Letsche
had plenty of big time experience having headlined two past season finales. This win has improved his record to 3-5-0.
..
Lauren Winston
had the best record going into DODGEBALL 125. The loss however negatively effects her now 4-5-1 standing.
..
Grant Cornero
had competed in only singles bouts heading into DODGEBALL 125. Failing to stay clean gives him a 1-3-0 record.
Thank You Captains!
The 125th extravaganza will surely go down as one of the greats. The team generals especially are each thanked for simply agreeing to a match of this kind.
CREAMation
contests only occur once every season as the number of willing participants is considerably low.
Moments & Stars
: Lauren Winston stumbling backward at the front line in the first game; Grant Cornero's sneaker falling off; John Tronolone accidentally eliminating teammate Michelle Mullins with a deflection
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Second Half of Season 13: The Road to CXXX
DODGEBALL 126: February 16, 2008
DODGEBALL 127: February 23, 2008 ..
WALL vs. ALL 5
DODGEBALL 128: March 1, 2008
DODGEBALL 129: March 8, 2008
DODGEBALL CXXX: March 15, 2008 ..
Main event to be announced at DB 127
.
body_html:
"... Take my ten event back!", Letsche loudly and proudly proclaimed just seconds before the 2007 ROOKIE of the Year was met with a pan-full of whipped-cream.

.......

The obsession with redemption was ever-so evident for the innovative catching machine Ryan Letsche and partner-in-crime Lauren Stopa, combining their unlimited resources just for an ounce, or a taste if you will, of vindication.

But the athletically-blessed Grant Cornero and EastCoastDodgeball framer Lauren Winston were the paper favorites heading into what many considered to be the most eagerly-anticipated mid-season showdown of them all.

Flash Results by Game
Letsche/Stopa: 2, 4, 5, 6
Cornero/Winston: 1, 3

The "Wild Wild West", otherwise known as the luckiest place in eastern Jersey, was hallowed ground on this wet and windy February '08 evening. Both pairs of resilient co-captains fought tooth and nail throughout, especially in the opening onslaughts.

The first four confrontations were equally divided amongst the leading generals. Game 5 however broke the curse of the "east" with the deadly Letsche-Stopa combo gaining the multiple point edge.

In the nail-biting finale, Cornero-Winston's match-tying efforts were remorselessly shot down and by the end of the barbaric six, the advantage leaned solely in favor of "The UnSTOPAble One" and her never-say-die commanding ally.

It's probably a safe bet to assume this was indeed one "sweet" victory for the Letsche-Stopa duo. Their 4 to 2 triumph allowed for these now timeless videos ...


CREAMation 5 RECORDS
> Attendance: 16
> New Players: 0

- Aside from the CREAMation 5, DODGEBALL 125 will also be remembered as Wet War XXV. What's odd is that only one CREAMation (C. Adams vs. Fitzpatrick) was not a Wet War - ain't that something!
- In the gigantic team brawl, Lauren Stopa and Ryan Letsche avenged their losses from times' past, defeating Lauren Winston and Grant Cornero, 4 to 2.
.. Lauren Stopa may have benefited the most: first woman to headline a mid-season main event (along with L. Winston); first team war; first win of her career (1-3-0)!
.. Ryan Letsche had plenty of big time experience having headlined two past season finales. This win has improved his record to 3-5-0.
.. Lauren Winston had the best record going into DODGEBALL 125. The loss however negatively effects her now 4-5-1 standing.
.. Grant Cornero had competed in only singles bouts heading into DODGEBALL 125. Failing to stay clean gives him a 1-3-0 record.

Thank You Captains!
The 125th extravaganza will surely go down as one of the greats. The team generals especially are each thanked for simply agreeing to a match of this kind. CREAMation contests only occur once every season as the number of willing participants is considerably low.

Moments & Stars: Lauren Winston stumbling backward at the front line in the first game; Grant Cornero's sneaker falling off; John Tronolone accidentally eliminating teammate Michelle Mullins with a deflection

~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

Second Half of Season 13: The Road to CXXX
DODGEBALL 126: February 16, 2008
DODGEBALL 127: February 23, 2008 .. WALL vs. ALL 5
DODGEBALL 128: March 1, 2008
DODGEBALL 129: March 8, 2008
DODGEBALL CXXX: March 15, 2008 .. Main event to be announced at DB 127.
